intro: Calyptranthes cumini, commonly known as the white-flowered calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Mexico, Guatemala, and parts of Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
